meanings.sent1: Her feeling of happiness was contagious.
meanings.sent2: I have a good feeling about this new job.
meanings.sent3: His feeling of excitement made him jump up and down.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of love enveloped them like a warm blanket.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of sadness lingered long after the movie ended.

meanings.sent1: The feeling of the soft blanket against her skin was comforting.
meanings.sent2: I had a strange feeling in my stomach after eating that sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The feeling of the cold water shocked him awake.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of the sun on her face was like a gentle caress.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of sand between his toes brought back childhood memories.

meanings.sent1: Her feeling was that honesty is always the best policy.
meanings.sent2: I have a strong feeling that we should go left, not right.
meanings.sent3: His feeling about the new restaurant was that it was overpriced.
meanings.sent4: The feeling that hard work pays off kept him motivated.
meanings.sent5: The feeling that nature is healing guided her to the forest.

meanings.definition: The capacity to experience emotions or physical sensations
meanings.sent1: His feeling allowed him to empathize with others easily.
meanings.sent2: The baby's feeling of touch was still developing.
meanings.sent3: The feeling of joy bubbled up inside her like fizzy soda.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of pain reminded him he was alive.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of gratitude filled her heart with warmth.
